chapterTitle: Introduction to Valuation:The Time Value of Money

columns.text: The "Brasher doubloon" is a rare American coin first issued in 1787. This one was featured in a novel as a plot element and in 2014 a coin was sold in an auction for $4,582,500 in 2014. It was also sold previously in 1979. **We want to calculate here at what rate did it appreciate during these periods of time.**

We know the following data:

Brasher doubloon
-

|Year	|Value|
|--|--|
1787	|$15
1979	|$430,000
2014| $4,582,500

To calculate at what rate has the coin appreciated during these periods of time we are going to use the Present Value formula and rearrange it to get the applied rate.

$$ \begin{aligned}
PV &= \frac{FV}{(1+r)^t} \\
\\
r& = \sqrt[t]{\frac{FV}{PV}}-1
\end{aligned}$$


*Where:*
- FV is the future value
- r is the applied rate
- t is the periods of time the rate is applied

First, we need to calculate how many years have passed since it was issued and the time it was sold for the first time.

$$ \begin{aligned}
 t &= 1979 - 1787\\
&= 192

\end{aligned}$$

The coin was sold 192 years later.

Now we can calculate at what rate the coin appreciated between 1787 and 1979.

$$ \begin{aligned}
r& = \sqrt[192]{\frac{\$430,000 }{\$15}}-1 \\
\\
& = \boxed{5.49\%}
\end{aligned}$$

The coin appreciated **5.49%** each year until 1979.

Now we want to know the annual rate the buyer earned on his purchase. For that we need to calculate the rate it appreciated between 1979 and 2014.

$$ \begin{aligned}
 t &= 2014 -1979 \\
&= 35

\end{aligned}$$

The buyer sold it in an auction 35 years later.

With that, we can calculate the appreciation rate during this period of time. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
r& = \sqrt[35]{\frac{\$4,582,500 }{\$430,000}}-1 \\
\\
& = \boxed{6.99\%}
\end{aligned}$$

So the buyer earned a rate of **6.99%** during the time he owned it until they sold it.

Finally, we want to calculate at what rate the coin appreciated since it was first issued up until 2014. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
 t &= 2014 -1787 \\
&= 227

\end{aligned}$$

227 have passed between it was the first issue and last sold in the auction.

Now we can calculate the rate.  

$$ \begin{aligned}
r& = \sqrt[227]{\frac{\$4,582,500 }{\$15}}-1 \\
\\
& = \boxed{5.72\%}
\end{aligned}$$

The coin appreciated at a rate of **5.72%** during this time period.
